title: Issue with Firefox Nightly
content:
Hi, I've been using Nightly due to the stable version of Firefox having stutter/performance issues that doesn't seem to occur in Nightly (something to do with Vsync and/or FPS on high refresh rate gaming monitors perhaps? This can be seen on testufo.com as well as in general when scrolling pages).

The issue I'm having with Nightly is that it often leaves background processes open in Task Manger after exiting. This does not occur in stable as far as I can tell. These background processes are causing issues when trying to update Nightly via the menu, as Nightly closes and tries to update but the background processes remain. The only thing to do is to kill the processes (sometimes as many as 20 of them) and then Nightly is able to update by itself and restart.

I've noticed that the command line for some of these processes show links that I have clicked from outside of Nightly (In Discord for example), but the processes do not immediately appear when clicking links and seem to appear at random while using the browser. Some of them also show stuff along the lines of "contentprocess" and "gecko-crash-server-pipe" which seems to be normal firefox.exe processes that run in the foreground, perhaps before being "converted" into background processes which in turn won't close.

Another thing I've noticed is when these background processes exist, it causes lag and other issues in, as well as a huge delay when clicking links outside of Nightly.

This has been going on for about a month (through all the daily updates) since I've installed Nightly. I've tried disabling add-ons, refreshing, and even completely uninstalling, wiping all traces of, and reinstalling Nightly, to no avail.
creator: marcmy

title: Firefox shows this error while visiting some Microsoft sites: MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_OCSP_RESPONSE_FOR_CERT_MISSING

title: Auto Upgrade 95.0 (64bit) Mac OS lost everything
content: How can I restore FF to the previous version that I had as the update carried nothing over? I did manage to find my previous bookmarks json file in a folder in my Mac but I couldn't load them into Bookmarks but I can access them all, from an odd location. I had it set up perfectly for my needs which I did over time, but it's all gone. All the add ons disappeared and most not available on 95.0. I've been using FF since the beginning of FF and never had this problem. In the past there was a notification to upgrade which I could accept or decline but that seems to be gone. In those instances I'd keep my old profile and make a new one and could revert back to the old one if needed which 99% of the time I didn't need to. But this time it just updated when I opened it so I couldn't back up the old profile. Web Security is not an issue for me as I have the best app for that plus VPN on all the time. Even when I lived in Communist China I never had any security issues.

title: Nova Launcher unable to backup Firefox Home Page shortcuts on Android
content:
I am unable to backup my home page shortcuts created with Firefox but shortcuts created with Chrome & Brave are fine.

Background: I live in a multi-lingual environment and I have a lot of different interests. So I make use of Home Page folders extensively, so I can create links to websites, some which translate automatically and some which keep the language without translation.

I am using Nova Launcher (App version 7) which offers home page backup facility. I recently accidentally deleted a folder and used the Nova Restore to bring everything back. In theory, if I migrate to a new phone I can do the same and restore all of my home pages. I create a lot of folders and load them with Apps or Shortcuts to website URLs. Because I invest a lot of time creating folders I want to be able to back them up.

I contacted Nova Support (TeslaCoil Apps) and their response was:

"Nothing went wrong actually. Google doesn't allow shortcuts to be backed up and restored due to security and privacy reasons."

So I asked them why Chrome & Brave shortcuts were backed up but not Firefox they said:

There are some types of shortcuts that get backed up, and some don't. That's all up to Google on how they are created and what they are labeled as.

So my questions are:

1) Are the Nova Support talking Bull-sh*t?

2) Can Firefox (Android) be modified to create a type of shortcut, like Chrome or Brave, that can be backed-up?

3) When Firefox creates a shortcut, can it create a different type of file with the settings allowing backup?

Thanks in advance for answers.
creator: NickZ123

title: Need to increase width of bookmarks toolbar overflow (previous CSS no longer works)
content:
I use Firefox ESR on Windows 7 (with extended security support).

ESR's base version recently updated from 78 to 91...frustratingly just a little too late to simply disable Proton :(. With a good deal of searching and experimenting, I found ways to update/modify my userChrome.css file to get things to look and work largely as I prefer.

The exception -- a BIG one to me -- is loss of the ability to remove the width restriction from the bookmarks toolbar overflow. In fact, I can't find a way to widen it at all. For years I had an add-on which accomplished the task (called something like "Places Full Titles"), and more recently -- after the add-on stopped working -- a few lines in my userChrome.css which accomplished the same. But that code no longer seems to do anything. It was: 

#personal-bookmarks .bookmark-item, #bookmarksMenuPopup .bookmark-item { max-width: none !important; }


Is there any newer css code -- or any alternate approach -- that will accomplish the same thing? I really pack a LOT of useful-to-me (but non-confidential) info into those bookmark names.

Thanks.

title: Restore Previous Session after clicking the button when I shouldn't have thereby wiping it
content: I lost 300ish tabs because I clicked the "restore previous session" button a few seconds before I got the final confirmation that my internet was activated because I was impatient. Following various other similar questions, I've used ShadowExplorer to grab the previous.jsonlz4, recovery.baklz4, and recovery.jsonlz4 and through the use of https://www.jeffersonscher.com/ffu/scrounger.html I have confirmed that they are the correct browsing session or are close enough. I cannot get Firefox to use these files when they're in the Users/Name/AppData/Roaming/Mozilla/Firefox/Profiles/string of characters.default-release folder (renaming the current iterations to replace them & even removing them from the folder didn't work, it still restored my session of looking up how to restore the session before that one), and I'm worried that it's because they aren't complete sine the scrounging tool eventually stops showing characters in its display (instead it's four zero's arranged in a square) and it can't identify beyond the first 5 tabs. There weren't any truly important tabs open, mostly stuff that I came across by chance that I thought I'd look at sooner than I did and will be difficult to find again and a backlog from various YouTubers I'm subscribed to because I hate "watch later". Is there anything I can do, or should I just give up on restoring this session?

title: How Prevent Firefox Screen Dimmer?
content:
The exact version doesn't matter, but I am using Firefox v. 95.0 (64 bit). Earlier, recent versions had the same problem. I am using Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS.

When I click to select one of many available choices, Firefox often automatically dims the screen. If I stop typing, the screen is slowly returned to its normal, bright state. I can keep working with the dimmed screen, but it is very aggravating and error-prone.

An example is at https://species.wikimedia.org/wiki/Zyras, which gives numerous choice selections. Try quickly selecting and then exitting several nearby choices.

I can speed up the return of brightness by using a shell window to run "xrandr --output HDMI-1 --brightness 1.00; xset s noblank; xset s off; xset -dpms" and then quickly selecting (in my LG Settings/Displays window) "Fractional Scaling" scale OFF (100%) and then ON (100% vs "125% 150% 175% 200%") several (up to 30) times.

HOW DO I COMPLETELY TURN OFF THE FIREFOX SCREEN DIMMER?
creator: jwill1000000
